wisdom.sentence: A definition of teaching: casting fake pearls before real swine.
wisdom.author: Bill Cain, "Stand Up Tragedy"

wisdom.sentence: A fool's brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry.  Hence University education.
wisdom.author: G. B. Shaw

wisdom.sentence: A grammarian's life is always in tense.
A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.sentence: A pencil with no point needs no eraser.
A professor is one who talks in someone else's sleep.
A student who changes the course of history is probably taking an exam.
A synonym is a word you use when you can't spell the word you first thought of.
wisdom.author: Burt Bacharach

wisdom.sentence: A tautology is a thing which is tautological.
A university is what a college becomes when the faculty loses interest in students.
wisdom.author: John Ciardi

wisdom.sentence: "A University without students is like an ointment without a fly."
wisdom.author: Ed Nather, professor of astronomy at UT Austin

wisdom.sentence: About all some men accomplish in life is to send a son to Harvard.
Academic politics is the most vicious and bitter form of politics, because the stakes are so low.
wisdom.author: Wallace Sayre

wisdom.sentence: Academicians care, that's who.
An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.sentence: Any two philosophers can tell each other all they know in two hours.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

wisdom.sentence: As Gen. de Gaulle occassionally acknowledges America to be the daughter of Europe, so I am pleased to come to Yale, the daughter of Harvard.
wisdom.author: J.F. Kennedy

wisdom.sentence: As long as the answer is right, who cares if the question is wrong?
British education is probably the best in the world, if you can survive it.  If you can't there is nothing left for you but the diplomatic corps.
wisdom.author: Peter Ustinov

wisdom.sentence: Campus sidewalks never exist as the straightest line between two points.
wisdom.author: M. M. Johnston

wisdom.sentence: Comparing information and knowledge is like asking whether the fatness of a pig is more or less green than the designated hitter rule."
wisdom.author: David Guaspari

wisdom.sentence: Department chairmen never die, they just lose their faculties.
Did you know the University of Iowa closed down after someone stole the book?
Do not clog intellect's sluices with bits of knowledge of questionable uses.
Do you think that illiterate people get the full effect of alphabet soup?
Education and religion are two things not regulated by supply and demand.  The less of either the people have, the less they want.
wisdom.author: Charlotte Observer, 1897

wisdom.sentence: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, "The Critic as Artist"

wisdom.sentence: Education is learning what you didn't even know you didn't know.
wisdom.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

wisdom.sentence: Education is the process of casting false pearls before real swine.
wisdom.author: Irwin Edman

wisdom.sentence: Education is what survives when what has been learnt has been forgotten.
wisdom.author: B.F. Skinner

wisdom.sentence: Eloquence is logic on fire.
Encyclopedia for sale by father.  Son knows everything.
Even if you do learn to speak correct English, whom are you going to speak it to?
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.sentence: Examinations are formidable even to the best prepared, for even the greatest fool may ask more the the wisest man can answer.
wisdom.author: C.C. Colton

wisdom.sentence: Experience is the worst teacher.  It always gives the test first and the instruction afterward.
F u cn rd ths u cnt spl wrth a dm!
f u cn rd ths, itn tyg h myxbl cd.
f u cn rd ths, u cn gt a gd jb n cmptr prgrmmng.
f u cn rd ths, u r prbbly a lsy spllr.
Going to church does not make a person religious, nor does going to school make a person educated, any more than going to a garage makes a person a car.
Good day to avoid cops.  Crawl to school.
Good teaching is one-fourth preparation and three-fourths good theatre.
wisdom.author: Gail Godwin

wisdom.sentence: Graduate life: It's not just a job.  It's an indenture.
Graduate students and most professors are no smarter than undergrads. They're just older.
He that teaches himself has a fool for a master.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.sentence: "He was a modest, good-humored boy.  It was Oxford that made him insufferable."
[He] took me into his library and showed me his books, of which he had a complete set.
wisdom.author: Ring Lardner

wisdom.sentence: Higher education helps your earning capacity.  Ask any college professor.
History books which contain no lies are extremely dull.
History is nothing but a collection of fables and useless trifles, cluttered up with a mass of unnecessary figures and proper names.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy

wisdom.sentence: How do you explain school to a higher intelligence?
wisdom.author: Elliot, "E.T."

wisdom.sentence: I am a bookaholic.  If you are a decent person, you will not sell me another book.
"I am not sure what this is, but an `F' would only dignify it."
wisdom.author: English Professor

wisdom.sentence: I am returning this otherwise good typing paper to you because someone has printed gibberish all over it and put your name at the top.
wisdom.author: Professor Lowd, English, Ohio University

wisdom.sentence: I came out of twelve years of college and I didn't even know how to sew. All I could do was account -- I couldn't even account for myself.
wisdom.author: Firesign Theatre

wisdom.sentence: I came to MIT to get an education for myself and a diploma for my mother.
I have made this letter longer than usual because I lack the time to make it shorter.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.sentence: "I have to convince you, or at least snow you ..."
wisdom.author: Prof. Romas Aleliunas, CS 435

wisdom.sentence: I heard a definition of an intellectual, that I thought was very interesting: a man who takes more words than are necessary to tell more than he knows.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.sentence: I respect faith, but doubt is what gives you an education.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner

wisdom.sentence: I think your opinions are reasonable, except for the one about my mental instability.
wisdom.author: Psychology Professor, Farifield University

wisdom.sentence: "I'm returning this note to you, instead of your paper, because it (your paper) presently occupies the bottom of my bird cage."
wisdom.author: English Professor, Providence College

wisdom.sentence: If any man wishes to be humbled and mortified, let him become president of Harvard.
wisdom.author: Edward Holyoke

wisdom.sentence: If he had only learnt a little less, how infinitely better he might have taught much more!
If ignorance is bliss, why aren't there more happy people?
If little else, the brain is an educational toy.
wisdom.author: Tom Robbins

wisdom.sentence: If someone had told me I would be Pope one day, I would have studied harder.
wisdom.author: Pope John Paul I

wisdom.sentence: If truth is beauty, how come no one has their hair done in the library?
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.sentence: If we spoke a different language, we would perceive a somewhat different world.
wisdom.author: Wittgenstein

wisdom.sentence: If you are too busy to read, then you are too busy.
If you can't read this, blame a teacher.
If you resist reading what you disagree with, how will you ever acquire deeper insights into what you believe? The things most worth reading are precisely those that challenge our convictions.
If you think education is expensive, try ignorance.
wisdom.author: Derek Bok, president of Harvard

wisdom.sentence: If you took all the students that felt asleep in class and laid them end to end, they'd be a lot more comfortable.
wisdom.author: "Graffiti in the Big Ten"

wisdom.sentence: "If you understand what you're doing, you're not learning anything."
wisdom.author: A. L.

wisdom.sentence: Ignorance is never out of style.  It was in fashion yesterday, it is the rage today, and it will set the pace tomorrow.
wisdom.author: Franklin K. Dane

wisdom.sentence: Ignorance is when you don't know anything and somebody finds it out.
Ignorance must certainly be bliss or there wouldn't be so many people so resolutely pursuing it.
Illiterate?  Write today, for free help!
Iowa State -- the high school after high school!
wisdom.author: Crow T. Robot

wisdom.sentence: Joe Cool always spends the first two weeks at college sailing his frisbee.
wisdom.author: Snoopy

wisdom.sentence: Learned men are the cisterns of knowledge, not the fountainheads.
Learning at some schools is like drinking from a firehose.
Learning without thought is labor lost; thought without learning is perilous.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.sentence: Maybe ain't ain't so correct, but I notice that lots of folks who ain't using ain't ain't eatin' well.
wisdom.author: Will Rogers

wisdom.sentence: Most seminars have a happy ending.  Everyone's glad when they're over.
My father, a good man, told me, "Never lose your ignorance; you cannot replace it."
wisdom.author: Erich Maria Remarque

wisdom.sentence: Never have so many understood so little about so much.
wisdom.author: James Burke

wisdom.sentence: Never let your schooling interfere with your education.
No discipline is ever requisite to force attendance upon lectures which are really worth the attending.
wisdom.author: Adam Smith, "The Wealth of Nations"

wisdom.sentence: No matter who you are, some scholar can show you the great idea you had was had by someone before you.
No wonder you're tired!  You understood so much today.
"OK, now let's look at four dimensions on the blackboard."
wisdom.author: Dr. Joy

wisdom.sentence: OK, so you're a Ph.D.  Just don't touch anything.
One cannot make an omelette without breaking eggs -- but it is amazing how many eggs one can break without making a decent omelette.
wisdom.author: Professor Charles P. Issawi

wisdom.sentence: "Plaese porrf raed."
wisdom.author: Prof. Michael O'Longhlin, S.U.N.Y. Purchase

wisdom.sentence: Practice is the best of all instructors.
wisdom.author: Publilius

wisdom.sentence: Professor Gorden Newell threw another shutout in last week's Chem Eng. 130 midterm.  Once again a student did not receive a single point on his exam. Newell has now tossed 5 shutouts this quarter. Newell's earned exam average has now dropped to a phenomenal 30
Reading is thinking with someone else's head instead of one's own.
Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.
Reporter:   "How did you like school when you were growing up, Yogi?" Yogi Berra: "Closed."
Smartness runs in my family.  When I went to school I was so smart my teacher was in my class for five years.
wisdom.author: George Burns

wisdom.sentence: Some scholars are like donkeys, they merely carry a lot of books.
wisdom.author: Folk saying

wisdom.sentence: "Speed is subsittute fo accurancy."
Spelling is a lossed art.
Suddenly, Professor Liebowitz realizes he has come to the seminar without his duck ...
Teachers have class.
The 'A' is for content, the 'minus' is for not typing it.  Don't ever do this to my eyes again.
wisdom.author: Professor Ronald Brady, Philosophy, Ramapo State College

wisdom.sentence: The alarm clock that is louder than God's own belongs to the roommate with the earliest class.
The average Ph.D thesis is nothing but the transference of bones from one graveyard to another.
wisdom.author: J. Frank Dobie, "A Texan in England"

wisdom.sentence: The avocation of assessing the failures of better men can be turned into a comfortable livelihood, providing you back it up with a Ph.D.
wisdom.author: Nelson Algren, "Writers at Work"

wisdom.sentence: The brain is a wonderful organ; it starts working the moment you get up in the morning, and does not stop until you get to school.
The college graduate is presented with a sheepskin to cover his intellectual nakedness.
wisdom.author: Robert M. Hutchins

wisdom.sentence: The end of the world will occur at three p.m., this Friday, with symposium to follow.
The future is a race between education and catastrophe.
wisdom.author: H.G. Wells

wisdom.sentence: The important thing is not to stop questioning.
The man who has never been flogged has never been taught.
wisdom.author: Menander

wisdom.sentence: The only thing that experience teaches us is that experience teaches us nothing.
wisdom.author: Andre Maurois (Emile Herzog)

wisdom.sentence: The problem with graduate students, in general, is that they have to sleep every few days.
The ratio of literacy to illiteracy is a constant, but nowadays the illiterates can read.
wisdom.author: Alberto Moravia

wisdom.sentence: The real purpose of books is to trap the mind into doing its own thinking.
wisdom.author: Christopher Morley

wisdom.sentence: "The student in question is performing minimally for his peer group and is an emerging underachiever."
The sum of the intelligence of the world is constant.  The population is, of course, growing.
The sunlights differ, but there is only one darkness.
wisdom.author: Ursula K. LeGuin, "The Dispossessed"

wisdom.sentence: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time and still retain the ability to function.
wisdom.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

wisdom.sentence: The three best things about going to school are June, July, and August.
The Tree of Learning bears the noblest fruit, but noble fruit tastes bad.
The world is coming to an end! Repent and return those library books!
The world is full of people who have never, since childhood, met an open doorway with an open mind.
wisdom.author: E.B. White

wisdom.sentence: There are no answers, only cross-references.
wisdom.author: Weiner

wisdom.sentence: This is the sort of English up with which I will not put.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: Those who educate children well are more to be honored than parents, for these only gave life, those the art of living well.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.sentence: Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its pupils.
wisdom.author: Hector Berlioz

wisdom.sentence: To craunch a marmoset.
wisdom.author: Pedro Carolino, "English as She is Spoke"

wisdom.sentence: To teach is to learn twice.
wisdom.author: Joseph Joubert

wisdom.sentence: To teach is to learn.
Try not to have a good time ... This is supposed to be educational.
wisdom.author: Charles Schulz

wisdom.sentence: Trying to get an education here is like trying to get a drink from a fire hose.
Universities are places of knowledge.  The freshman each bring a little in with them, and the seniors take none away, so knowledge accumulates.
University politics are vicious precisely because the stakes are so small.
wisdom.author: Henry Kissinger

wisdom.sentence: "We demand rigidly defined areas of doubt and uncertainty!"
wisdom.author: Vroomfondel

wisdom.sentence: What does education often do?  It makes a straight cut ditch of a free meandering brook.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.sentence: What makes you think graduate school is supposed to be satisfying?
wisdom.author: Erica Jong, "Fear of Flying"

wisdom.sentence: What passes for optimism is most often the effect of an intellectual error.
wisdom.author: Raymond Aron, "The Opium of the Intellectuals"

wisdom.sentence: What we do not understand we do not possess.
wisdom.author: Goethe

wisdom.sentence: What's page one, a preemptive strike?
wisdom.author: Professor Freund, Communication, Ramapo State College

wisdom.sentence: When I was in school, I cheated on my metaphysics exam: I looked into the soul of the boy sitting next to me.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.sentence: Whenever anyone says, "theoretically," they really mean, "not really."
wisdom.author: Dave Parnas

wisdom.sentence: Where do I find the time for not reading so many books?
wisdom.author: Karl Kraus

wisdom.sentence: "Whom are you?" said he, for he had been to night school.
wisdom.author: George Ade

wisdom.sentence: You can't expect a boy to be vicious till he's been to a good school.
wisdom.author: H.H. Munro

wisdom.sentence: You don't have to think too hard when you talk to teachers.
wisdom.author: J. D. Salinger

wisdom.sentence: You may have heard that a dean is to faculty as a hydrant is to a dog.
wisdom.author: Alfred Kahn

wisdom.sentence: "You should, without hesitation, pound your typewriter into a plowshare, your paper into fertilizer, and enter agriculture"
wisdom.author: Business Professor, University of Georgia

wisdom.sentence: Your education begins where what is called your education is over.
